artist: Hashiguchi Goyō (self-published); Carved by Takano Shichinosuke; Printed by Somekawa Kanzō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: landscape; long bridge at R across calm water in falling snow; buildings on shore at L; several figures on bridge
marks: 大正九年一月 {Taishō kunen ichigatsu} (January 1920) 五葉画 {Goyō ga} (picture by Goyō)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
text: The Great Bridge of Sanjō is seen from the western bank of the Kamo River. Far back higher up in the mountains is Kiyomizu Temple with its pagoda visible.
title: The Great Bridge of Sanjō in Kyoto
